intro: Eriochilus paludosus, commonly known as the swamp everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in wet or swampy environments, often found in coastal areas and saltmarshes. Eriochilus paludosus is adapted to saline conditions and is an important component of coastal ecosystems.
